pr_title: Rework servlet 2 to not wrap HttpServletResponse objects

timeline.message: Rework servlet 2 to not wrap HttpServletResponse objects
Rework servlet 2 to not wrap HttpServletResponse objects

timeline.bodyText: Since you don't want to wrap it, can you instead instrument HttpServletResponse.setStatus (and other relevant methods) to capture the status in the contextStore directly instead of putting it into the request?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: What class do you think I should use as a ContextStore? Given that this is a map, I can't use HttpServletResponse for a second type from these instrumentations
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: Sorry I should expound on this more, because the Servlet2Advice class also has to interact with this context store, It would result in a duplicate key entry. I could create a wrapper object. I could probably find a way to trick things into supporting both
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: I don't think there's a problem in using a single key with two different values in contextStore.  Under the hood, they should be stored in distinct fields based off the value type.  (In other words, you should be able to use <HttpServletResponse, Integer> based on my understanding.)
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Right, what I mean is, in Servlet2Instrumentation I can't add both, which is needed as Servlet2Advice uses both
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: ah, I see.  What about using ServletResponse for one and HttpServletResponse for the other?
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I did that but it felt worse than a wrapper would be. I'll commit and we can discuss
replies.author: devinsba

timeline.bodyText: with the other change, this would likely need to be changed to just Integer and pass in the status code.
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: The cast is now gone, but thanks for the heads up!
